title: How to make good money as an artist or musician - Quora

response.answer_text: By moonlighting as a lawyer or brain surgeon. By learning to play very well. Learning to sight read and read charts quickly. Playing cover songs and getting into the union. And getting an agent who will get you on tour playing rhythm guitar for Ray Cyrus when he tours. Do this for a while and you’ll make enough to buy your own house, put a studio in the house, do your originals that never get anywhere. Then you go out and tour with Taylor Swift for four months. You’ll need an understanding wife and kids for this or they’ll divorce you take that house you bought with tour money and you’re back in a cheap apartment on Ivar Street in Hollywood with all the coke and heroin dealers. Oh, and she also got your guitar collection including pre-CBS amps and Starts, and Gibson guitars from the 1950s. As for an artist, learn to draw with Charcoals or Japanese Brush and become the house artist at places like Disneyland. You do portraits in 15 minutes and charge $100. You better be good! I remember the Art Walk in Los Angeles and this one artist had they anamorphic images of people that looked like they could make the cover of the New Yorker magazine and he was selling them like hot cakes for big bucks. Those pictures could also have been in Playboy and they didn’t need a caption. You looked at the picture and it said a million words bout the two people in it.

There are many ways to do this and I listed a few ones here: Discover 21 ways to make money with music! In order to make it really work, you have to follow a system to be able to make it work, a business model actually that I describe here: The old music business is dying… start your own business as a musician! But I will share the basic ideas below. The idea is to create content around you and your music so that people know that you exist. This takes time and dedication. You have to build traffic towards your music and the content your create. That’s where social media strategies and marketing come. But it is only the first step. Then you want them to pay attention to you and your creation by producing high quality music (or artwork). And something relevant to people that noticed you. Aim your messaging to the right people. The next step is to be consistent in quality and presence with your audience to make them fans. Give them lots of value. Offer them ways to be part of your artistic adventure, through exclusive content or simply by sharing a part of your world through social media for example. In exchange of what you bring, you will get money. Your loyal fans will be more than happy to pay to listen to you live or any other creation (including merchandises). If you only remember one thing: be consistent!
